name: Therapy and rehabilitation
description: Within Health, this field is the study of restoring normal physical and functional conditions to those incapacitated by temporary or permanent disability, through various therapeutic interventions.

name: Dietician programmes
description: Training for professionals who assess nutritional needs, plan dietary interventions, and provide nutrition counseling to promote health and manage disease, part of Therapy and rehabilitation.

name: Medical massage
description: The application of massage techniques for therapeutic purposes to address specific health conditions or injuries, within Therapy and rehabilitation.

name: Nutrition/Dietetics
description: The science of food and its effects on health, and the application of this knowledge to plan diets and promote healthy eating habits, a core component of Therapy and rehabilitation.

name: Occupational therapy
description: A client-centered health profession concerned with promoting health and well-being through occupation, enabling people to participate in the activities of everyday life, a key area in Therapy and rehabilitation.

name: Physiotherapy
description: The treatment of disease, injury, or deformity by physical methods such as massage, heat treatment, and exercise rather than by drugs or surgery, a major field within Therapy and rehabilitation.

name: Rehabilitation
description: The process of helping a person who has suffered an illness or injury restore lost skills and so regain maximum self-sufficiency, the overarching goal of Therapy and rehabilitation.

name: Speech therapy
description: The treatment of speech and language disorders, helping individuals improve their communication skills, a specialization within Therapy and rehabilitation.
